factoid: The old countess was wearing a nightcap and a dressing jacket.
The old countess had no false curls.
The old countess had a small knob of hair showing under her white cotton cap.
The old countess knelt on a rug and bowed to the ground while praying.
The old countess sighed and groaned during her prayer.
The old countess's door creaked when Natásha entered the room.
Natásha was wearing a dressing jacket.
Natásha had slippers on her bare feet.
Natásha had her hair in curlpapers.
Natásha ran into the room.
The old countess looked around and frowned after Natásha entered.
The old countess finished her last prayer, asking whether the couch would become her grave.
Natásha was flushed and eager.
Natásha saw the old countess in prayer.
Natásha checked her rush, half sat down, and unconsciously put out her tongue as if chiding herself.
Natásha saw that the old countess was still praying.
Natásha ran on tiptoe to the bed.
Natásha slipped one foot against the other and pushed off her slippers.
Natásha jumped onto the bed.
The old countess feared the bed might become her grave.
The couch was high.
The couch had a feather bed.
The couch had five pillows, each smaller than the one below.
Natásha jumped onto the couch.
Natásha sank into the feather bed.
Natásha rolled over to the wall.
Natásha snuggled up the bedclothes as she settled down.
Natásha raised her knees to her chin.
Natásha kicked out and laughed almost inaudibly.
Natásha covered herself from head to foot.
Natásha peeped at the old countess.
The old countess finished her prayers.
The old countess came to the bed with a stern face.
The old countess saw that Natásha's head was covered.
The old countess smiled in a kind, weak way.
The old countess said "Now then, now then!"
Natásha said "Mamma, can we have a talk? Yes?"
Natásha said "Now, just one on your throat and another... that’ll do!"
Natásha seized the old countess round the neck.
Natásha kissed the old countess on the throat.
Natásha seemed rough in her behavior toward the old countess.
Natásha was sensitive and tactful.
Natásha clasped the old countess without hurting her.
Natásha clasped the old countess without making her feel uncomfortable.
Natásha clasped the old countess without making her feel displeased.
The old countess said "Well, what is it tonight?"
The old countess arranged her pillows.
The old countess waited until Natásha settled down beside her under the quilt.
The old countess waited until Natásha spread out her arms.
The old countess waited until Natásha assumed a serious expression.
Natásha's visits at night before the count returned from his club were one of the greatest pleasures of the old countess and Natásha.
Natásha put her hand on the old countess's mouth.
Natásha said "About Borís... I know."
Natásha said "that’s what I have come about."
Natásha said "Don’t say it—I know."
Natásha said "No, do tell me!"
Natásha removed her hand.
Natásha said "Tell me, Mamma! He’s nice?"
The old countess said she was married at Natásha's age.
The old countess said she loves Borís like a son.
The old countess said Natásha has turned his head.
The old countess said she cannot marry Borís because he is young.
The old countess said she cannot marry Borís because he is poor.
The old countess said she cannot marry Borís because he is a relation.
The old countess said she cannot marry Borís because Natásha does not love him.
Natásha said "Why not?" without changing her position.
The old countess said "I know. It is not right, darling!"
Natásha said "But if I want to…"
The old countess said "Leave off talking nonsense."
The old countess said "But if I want…"
The old countess said "I am in earnest…"
Natásha did not let the old countess finish.
Natásha drew the old countess's large hand to herself.
Natásha kissed the old countess's hand on the back.
Natásha kissed the old countess's hand on the palm.
Natásha turned the old countess's hand over.
Natásha kissed the old countess's hand on one knuckle.
Natásha kissed the old countess's hand on the space between the knuckles.
Natásha kissed the old countess's hand on the next knuckle.
Natásha whispered "January, February, March, April, May."
Natásha whispered "Speak, Mamma, why don’t…"
